DataElement.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire Patient Primary Goal of Current Cancer Treatment 7 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of their loved one's primary goal for the current cancer treatment, using a 7 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire Patient's Primary Goal of Current Cancer Treatment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care._A question about a person's primary goal of the patient's current cancer treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Caregiver Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Concepts.definition: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Property.preferredName: Patient's Primary Goal of Current Cancer Treatment
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about a person's primary goal of the patient's current cancer treatment.

Concepts.longName: Patient's Primary Goal of Current Cancer Treatment
Concepts.definition: A question about a person's primary goal of the patient's current cancer treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 5/28/14

ValueDomain.preferredName: Primary Goal of Cancer Treatment 7 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard with seven text responses related to the goal of cancer treatment from lessening suffering as much as possible to helping with cancer research, including an option for other response.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Primary Goal to Help Cancer Research

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Primary Goal to Help Cancer Research
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to help cancer research.

Concepts.longName: Primary Goal to Help Cancer Research
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to help cancer research.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Primary Goal to Cure the Cancer

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Primary Goal to Cure the Cancer
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to cure the cancer.

Concepts.longName: Primary Goal to Cure the Cancer
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to cure the cancer.

PermissibleValues.value: To extend my life as long as possible

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to extend life as long as possible.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to extend life as long as possible.

PermissibleValues.value: To make sure I have done everything
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Primary Goal to Have Done Everything

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Primary Goal to Have Done Everything
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to make sure that everything has been done.

Concepts.longName: Primary Goal to Have Done Everything
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to make sure that everything has been done.

PermissibleValues.value: For me and/or my family to be able to keep hoping

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to be able to keep hoping.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to be able to keep hoping.

PermissibleValues.value: To lessen my suffering as much as possible

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to reduce suffering.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's primary treatment goal is to reduce suffering.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 5/28/14

ReferenceDocuments.name: If you had to choose one, wha
ReferenceDocuments.description: If you had to choose one, what would you say is your loved one's primary goal of their current cancer treatment?
